alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 6:24PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Navajo Nation near Houck through 700 PM Navajo Nation Time... At 622 PM Navajo Nation Time, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Houck, or 26 miles northwest of Zuni Pueblo, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Houck and Oak Springs Valley. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 341 and 359. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
